snippet: Pupils are not more likely to leave New York City charter schools than their counterparts at traditional public schools, but that is not the case for special education students, a study found.
abstract: Results of study conducted by New York City's Independent Budget Office concludes that, in general, special education students leave charter schools far more often than their counterparts at traditional public schools; findings address common criticism of charter schools.
lead_paragraph: Pupils are not more likely to leave New York City charter schools than their counterparts at traditional public schools, but that is not the case for special education students, a study found.

headline.main: City Study Tracks Transfers by Charter School Students
headline.print_headline: City Study Tracks Transfers By Charter School Students
